00020 // acceleration flags, use in the driver declaration to provide access to 
00021 // hardware accelerated implementations.
00022 #define ACCELERATED_CLEAR                       (0x0001)
00023 #define ACCELERATED_POINT                       (0x0002)
00024 #define ACCELERATED_LINE                        (0x0004)
00025 #define ACCELERATED_CIRCLE                      (0x0008)
00026 #define ACCELERATED_ELLPISE                     (0x0010)
00027 #define ACCELERATED_RECTANGLE           (0x0020)
00028 #define ACCELERATED_TEXT                        (0x0040)
00029 #define ACCELERATED_CONSOLE_TEXT        (0x0080)
00030 #define ACCELERATED_STAMP                       (0x0100)
00031 #define ACCELERATED_BITMAP                      (0x0200)
00032 
00033 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00034 typedef void (*DRAW_PIXEL_FUNC)(void *pstThis_, void *pstPixel_);
00035 
00036 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00037 typedef struct
00038 {
00039         // Must be first!!!
00040         DRIVER_STRUCT *pstDriver;
00041 
00042         // These are for all display drivers
00043         USHORT usResX;
00044         USHORT usResY;
00045         UCHAR ucBPP;
00046         USHORT usAccelerationFlags;
00047         
00048         // Must be implemented for software rendering.
00049         DRAW_PIXEL_FUNC pfDrawPixel;
00050         
00051 } DISPLAY_DRIVER_STRUCT;
00052 
00053 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054 // Event definitions for 2D hardware accelerated graphics functions
00055 typedef enum
00056 {
00057         //--[Mandatory for a display driver]-------------------------------------
00058         DISPLAY_EVENT_PIXEL = DRIVER_EVENTS,    
00059         
00060         //--[Optional if supported in hardware]----------------------------------
00061         DISPLAY_EVENT_CLEAR,
00062         DISPLAY_EVENT_LINE,
00063         DISPLAY_EVENT_RECTANGLE,
00064         DISPLAY_EVENT_CIRCLE,
00065         DISPLAY_EVENT_ELLIPSE,
00066         DISPLAY_EVENT_BITMAP,
00067         DISPLAY_EVENT_STAMP,
00068         DISPLAY_EVENT_TEXT,
00069         DISPLAY_EVENT_CONSOLE_TEXT
00070 } DISPLAY_EVENT;
